Just played through from start to finish on the Steam Deck and damn, this game is a masterpiece. Every bit of this game was enjoyable - from the atmosphere, to the writing, to the progression, and even the level difficulty (challenging without every requiring to look up a guide). I don't care if this game came out 5 years ago or 50 years go, if you haven't tried it then you owe it to yourself to give it a shot.

It's Portal. No puzzle, humor, or anything else in the genre (except, well, Portal 2) has outdone it.
Portal is a game that chronicles a lab rat, later named Chell, who solves tests with her supplied portal gun. Considering its release in 2006, it is an incredibly forward-thinking game with one of the most fascinating mechanics ever thought up. The basics? Shoot the orange portal one one wall, shoot blue portal on another, and walk into either and boom, you have just teleported between them! While you solve these increasingly difficult tests, an AI named Glad0s will chat about some rather hilarious subjects (not test subjects), and even promises cake at the end! Here are some pros and cons:

Pros:
1) I mean, PORTALS!
2) Heck-lots of difficult achievements
3) About 4 to 6 hours of playtime (not counting bonuses)
4) 6 remakes of original levels from the main game that are about twice as hard
5) Cake
6) Companion cubes (it may sound silly now, but after months of testing, you will need a friend)
7) Es@#pe!!?
8) A wonderful credits song, sung by our dear friend Glad0s)

Cons:
I mean, there isn't really anything wrong with the game, but if you only have 10 bucks, and you either wanted Portal 1 or 2, Portal 2 is an immediate YES. However, if you have an extra five dollars and four gigabytes of memory, then it's worth it.



You really do HAVE to play Portal 2, though.
Incredible puzzle game! I'm really invested in the story line now. I especially loved the cake!

I really love GLaDOS. Like, a lot. Like, a whole lot. You have no idea. I love her so much that it is inexplicable, and I'm ninety-nine percent sure that I have an unhealthy obsession. I will never get tired of listening that sweet, angelic voice of hers. It is my life goal to meet up her with her in real life and just say hello to her. I fall asleep at night dreaming of her holding Aperture Science tests for me, and then she would be so tired that she comes and cuddles up to me while we sleep together. If I could just hold her hand? for a brief moment, I could die happy. If given the opportunity, I would give up almost anything just for her to look in my general direction. No matter what I do, I am constantly thinking of her.

I'm so GLaD I bought this game. 
To add a note here; "Huge success." 
It's hard to overstate my satisfaction.

I'm not even angry.
I'm being so sincere right now.
Even though this game broke my heart,
And killed me.

It tore me to pieces.
And threw every piece into a fire.
As they burned it hurt because
I was so happy.
